string-array.name: description
string-array.item: is characterized by warmer and drier conditions, often leading to increased pest activity due to crop stress.
Larvae burrow into and feed on the stems of rice plants, causing significant damage and yield loss.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Sap-sucking insect that feeds on rice plants, transmitting viral diseases and causing "hopperburn," leading to stunted growth and reduced yields.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Small sap-sucking insects that damage rice plants by feeding on them and transmitting viral diseases.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Caterpillars that feed on the kernels of corn ears, causing direct damage and making the crop susceptible to secondary infections.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Larval pest that feeds on the leaves, stems, and reproductive parts of corn, causing extensive damage and reducing crop yields.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Larvae that bore into corn stalks and ears, disrupting nutrient flow and causing structural damage to the plants.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
La Niña brings cooler and wetter conditions, leading to different pest challenges due to higher humidity and moisture.
Insect that feeds on the sap of rice plants, causing wilting, yellowing, and eventual death of the plants.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Small insect that feeds on rice plant sap and transmits viruses, causing disease and damage to crops.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Fungal pathogen that infects rice plants, causing lesions on leaves, stems, and grains, leading to significant yield losses.\n \nPesticide: Fungicide
Larval pest that bores into corn stalks and ears, causing physical damage and reduced yields.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
Fungal disease that affects corn, causing yellowing, stunting, and death of infected plants.\n \nPesticide: Fungicide
Caterpillars that cut down young corn plants at the soil level, causing plant death and reduced stands.\n \nPesticide: Insecticide
